FuncDef: The reset dhcp snooping user-bind command clears DHCP snooping binding entries. The reset dhcp snooping user-bind command clears DHCP snooping binding entries.
CLIs: reset dhcp snooping user-bind [ vlan <vlan-id> | interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Clears DHCP snooping binding entries mapping a specified VLAN ID.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1023.

interface-name specifies the name of an interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Clears DHCP snooping binding entries mapping a specified IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Clears DHCP snooping binding entries in a specified BD.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Examples: Warning: DHCP snooping bind-table will be reset. Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo: After DHCP snooping is enabled, DHCP snooping binding entries are generated after DHCP users go online. This command can be run to clear binding entries containing a specified parameter. If no parameter is specified, all binding entries are cleared.
